question: Which of the following determines the speed of recovery from IV anesthetic agents?
exp: IV anesthetic agents are give by infusion. Infusion maintains the serum concentration of anesthetic agent high which causes the drug to attach to highly perfused organ i. e CNS. Once the infusion is stopped the serum concentration decreases and drug detaches from CNS and gets redistributed to other organs Hence redistribution of drug from CNS determines the speed of recovery from IV anesthetic
opc: Redistribution of the drug from sites in the CNS

question: In a patient with severe aoic Stenosis which of the following anesthetic techniques is least preferred:
exp: Spinal anesthesia is an absolute contra-indication in severe heart disease as it can cause severe hemodynamic instability Etomidate is cardio vascular stable Propofol can be used with caution in patients with severe heart disease Epidural anesthesia can be used with caution in patient with severe heart disease

question: Anesthesia of choice for induction in children among the following is:
exp: o Sevoflurane is a sweet smelling anesthetic agent and has fast onset of action. Hence it is the preferred agent for induction o Desflurane has the fastest onset of action but has a pungent smell and can cause laryngospasm o Isoflurane has an irritant smell and hence not used for induction o Halothane can be used for induction

question: Which of the following is false about light anesthesia?
exp: In Light anesthesia: o Patients have memory of the period o Pain may be felt during light anesthesia Light anesthesia is desirable in ceain conditions and can lead to PTSD BIS and Entropy monitors measures the depth of anesthesia
opa: Patient does not have explicit memory of the period
opb: Pain may be felt during light anesthesia
opc: Is desirable is ceain high risk conditions
opd: Can lead to Posttraumatic stress disorders
